text.div:
BSeR_BidirectionalServices_eReferral

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

http://hl7.org/fhir/us/bser/ImplementationGuide/hl7.fhir.us.bser

The Bidirectional Services eReferral (BSeR) FHIR implementation guide provides guidance for using the HL7 Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR) standard as an exchange format for clinical and non-clinical service requests. It is a collection of profiled FHIR resources designed for use in information exchanges supporting the placement of a service request by a referral initiating provider and the reporting of service delivery outcomes by a referral recipient provider. The goal of the BSeR project is to streamline and enhance the efficacy of the exchange of health information between health care systems and community services organizations involved in addressing chronic health conditions by establishing information exchange standards for electronic referrals and referral outcome reporting.

name: BSeR_BidirectionalServices_eReferral
title: BSeR: Bidirectional Services_eReferral
publisher: HL7 International - Public Health Work Group

contact.name: HL7 International - Public Health Work Group

description: The Bidirectional Services eReferral (BSeR) FHIR implementation guide provides guidance for using the HL7 Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR) standard as an exchange format for clinical and non-clinical service requests. It is a collection of profiled FHIR resources designed for use in information exchanges supporting the placement of a service request by a referral initiating provider and the reporting of service delivery outcomes by a referral recipient provider. The goal of the BSeR project is to streamline and enhance the efficacy of the exchange of health information between health care systems and community services organizations involved in addressing chronic health conditions by establishing information exchange standards for electronic referrals and referral outcome reporting.

grouping.name: Service Request and Referral Feedback Supporting Information Bundles

resource.name: BSeR_ReferralMessageHeader
resource.description: The FHIR MessageHeader resource is defined as "the header for a message exchange that is either requesting or responding to an action". In BSeR the message header is used to exchange the referral services request or the referral service request feedback.

resource.name: BSeR_ReferralTask
resource.description: A task resource describes an activity that can be performed and tracks the state of completion of that activity. It is used in BSeR to track the performance and state of completion of the referral service request.

resource.name: BSeR_ReferralInitiatorPractitionerRole
resource.description: The FHIR R4 PractitionerRole resource covers the recording of the location and types of services that Practitioners are able to provide for an organization. This profile for the PractitionerRole resource represents the practitioner in the role of referral initiator.

resource.name: BSeR_ReferralRecipientPractitionerRole
resource.description: The FHIR R4 PractitionerRole resource covers the recording of the location and types of services that Practitioners are able to provide for an organization. This profile for the PractitionerRole resource represents the practitioner in the role of referral recipient.

resource.name: BSeR_ReferralServiceRequest
resource.description: The referral service request is a profile of the FHIR ServiceRequest resource, a record of a request for service such as diagnostic investigations, treatments, or operations to be performed.

resource.name: BSeR_ReferralFeedbackComposition
resource.description: The structural body and metadata of the referral feedback document.

resource.name: Capability Statement BSeR
resource.description: This resource defines the expected capabilities for both client and server participating in BSeR exchange

resource.name: BSeR_ArthritisReferralSupportingInformation
resource.description: A bundle of clinical statements authored by the referral initiator as supporting information for a arthritis related service request referral.

resource.name: BSeR_HypertensionReferralSupportingInformation
resource.description: A bundle of clinical statements authored by the referral initiator as supporting information for a hypertension referral.

resource.name: BSeR_EarlyChildhoodNutritionReferralSupportingInformation
resource.description: A bundle of clinical statements authored by the referral initiator as supporting information for early childhood nutrition referral.

resource.name: BSeR_DiabetesPreventionReferralSupportingInformation
resource.description: A bundle of clinical statements authored by the referral initiator as supporting information for a diabetes prevention related referral.

resource.name: BSeR_TobaccoUseCessationReferralSupportingInformation
resource.description: A bundle of clinical statements authored by the referral initiator as supporting information for a tobacco use cessation service request referral.

resource.name: BSeR_ObesityReferralSupportingInformation
resource.description: A bundle of clinical statements authored by the referral initiator as supporting information for an obesity referral.

reference.display: Saint Luke's Hospital of Kansas City

resource.name: Saint Luke's Hospital of Kansas City
BSeR-TelcomCommunicationPreferences
resource.description: A collection of observations about the patient's preferences with regard to contact via telecommunication (phone/email) such as best Day To Call, best Time To Call, and leave Message Indicator.

resource.name: BSeR_EarlyChildhoodNutritionObservation
resource.description: A collection of observational data points authored by the referral initiator as part of supporting information related to an early childhood nutrition referral.

resource.name: BSeR_MedicationStatement
resource.description: A statement of a patient medication history used as supporting information for a patient service request referral.

resource.name: BSeR_NRT-AuthorizationStatus
resource.description: An observation regarding the status (approved, denied, pending) of an authorization for the patient to participate in Nicotine Replacement Therapy.

resource.name: BSeR_HA1C-Observation
resource.description: A measure of the amount or percentage of hemoglobin A1c in the patient's blood. This observation is used a supporting information primarily for diabetes prevention referrals.

resource.name: BSeR_ArthritisFeedbackObservation
resource.description: A collection of observational data points concerning the patient arthritic condition provided by the referral recipient as feedback to the referral initiator.

resource.name: BSeR_EarlyChildhoodNutritionFeedbackObservation
resource.description: A collection of observational data points authored by the referral recipient providing feedback to the referral initiator concerning an early childhood nutrition referral.

resource.name: BSeR_ParticipationFeedbackObservation
resource.description: An observation regarding the level of participation in the services provided by the referral recipient, such as the number of sessions attended.

resource.name: BSeR_TobaccoUseCessationFeedbackObservation
resource.description: A collection of observational data points provided by the referral recipient as feedback to the referral initiator. Tobacco use cessation feedback observations include quit Date, session type, and tobacco free duration.

resource.name: BSeR_ArthritisReferralFeedbackSupportingInformation
resource.description: A bundle of clinical statements providing supporting information for a referral recipients feedback on a arthritis referral.

resource.name: BSeR_DiabetesPreventionReferralFeedbackSupportingInformation
resource.description: A bundle of clinical statements authored by the referral recipient as supporting information for feedback provided to a referral initiator.

resource.name: BSeR_EarlyChildhoodNutritionReferralFeedbackSupportingInformation
resource.description: A bundle of clinical statements providing supporting information for a referral recipient's feedback on an early childhood nutrition referral.

resource.name: BSeR_HypertensionReferralFeedbackSupportingInformation
resource.description: A bundle of clinical statements authored by the referral recipient as supporting information for feedback provided to a referral initiator regarding a hypertension referral.

resource.name: BSeR_ObesityReferralFeedbackSupportingInformation
resource.description: A bundle of clinical statements authored by the referral recipient as supporting information for feedback provided to a referral initiator regarding a obesity referral.

resource.name: BSeR_TobaccoUseCessationReferralFeedbackSupportingInformation
resource.description: A bundle of clinical statements providing supporting information for a referral recipients feedback on a tobacco use cessation referral.

resource.name: BSeR Referral Message Bundle
resource.description: This Bundle profile represents a BSeR Referral Message Bundle. It contains the BSeR Referral MessageHeader and is for use in the BSeR messaging paradigm.

resource.name: BSeR_TobaccoUseCessationFeedbackMedication
resource.description: A statement regarding the use of a tobacco cessation medication. Medication.status indicates active or inactive use of the medication indicated in medication.code.

resource.name: BSeR_Diagnosis
resource.description: A health condition of the referral patient.

resource.name: BSeR_EducationLevel
resource.description: The highest level of education achieved by the patient. This is an optional demographic element of the patient included in all referral types.

resource.name: BSeR_Coverage
resource.description: Coverage high-level identifiers and descriptors of an insurance plan underwriting some or all of the cost of the referral services provided.

resource.name: BSeR_Organization
resource.description: An organization resource playing the roles of practitioner affiliated organization, patient coverage payer organization, or patient employer organization.

resource.name: BSeR_PatientConsent
resource.description: A observation regarding the consent status of the patient with regard to treatment authorization or protected health information sharing.

resource.name: BSeR_ReferralActivityStatus
resource.description: An observation made by the referral recipient regarding the state of the referral service request. This observation is included as part of the referral feedback as a further elaboration of the business state in task.

resource.name: BSeR_Practitioner
resource.description: An individual who are engaged in the health care process or health care-related services as part of their formal responsibilities.

resource.name: BSeR_ServiceDeliveryLocation
resource.description: Service delivery location is physical place used by a referral initiating practitioner or referral recipient practitioner as the location to deliver services.

resource.name: BSeR_ReferralFeedbackDocumentBundle
resource.description: This Bundle profile represents an BSeR Referral Feedback Document Bundle. It contains the BSeR Referral Feedback Composition.

resource.name: BSeR_ReferralRequestDocumentBundle
resource.description: This Bundle profile represents an BSeR Referral Request Document Bundle. It contains the BSeR Referral Request Composition.

resource.name: BSeR_ReferralRequestComposition
resource.description: The structural body and metadata of the referral request document.

page.title: Referral Service Request Feedback Clinical Statements
Service Request and Referral Feedback Supporting Information Bundles
Adaptation for Additional Referral Use Cases
